description: a(n) is the semiperimeter of the primitive Pythagorean triangle (x(n), y(n), z(n)) with x(n) < y(n) < z(n) and x(n) > x(n-1), y(n) > y(n-1), z(n) > z(n-1), which has the smallest perimeter (if there are several triangles with smallest perimeter: the one of these with the smallest area), starting from a(1) = (3 + 4 + 5)/2 = 6.
